intro: Palestinian labor movements have been at the forefront of anti-colonial resistance, organizing strikes against occupation, building worker solidarity across borders, and exposing Israeli apartheid through economic justice campaigns. Despite systematic repression, Palestinian workers continue to organize for liberation.

profiles.name: George Habash
profiles.bio: Founder of Popular Front for Liberation of Palestine (PFLP) who linked Palestinian struggle to global anti-imperialism. As physician, organized healthcare for refugees. Advocated for worker cooperatives in liberated zones. Died 2008 under house arrest in Jordan after Israeli pressure.
resistance_actions: Organized 1970s dockworker strikes against Israeli shipping
Established Palestinian worker cooperatives in Lebanon camps
Lobbied Arab trade unions to boycott Israeli goods
profiles.legacy: Inspired Labor for Palestine movement among diaspora workers

profiles.name: Kamal Nasser
profiles.bio: PFLP Secretary-General who organized Palestinian workers in Gulf states during 1970s oil boom. Advocated for Palestinian labor rights in Kuwait, Libya, and Iraq. Assassinated by Israeli Mossad in 1973 Athens attack. First major PFLP leader killed by Israel.
resistance_actions: Organized Palestinian worker unions in Gulf states
Negotiated labor protections for 100,000+ Palestinian workers
Established first Palestinian workers' credit union
profiles.legacy: His assassination sparked global Palestinian labor solidarity networks

profiles.name: Randa Hleih
profiles.bio: Head of Workers' Advice Center (WAC-MAAN) organizing Palestinian workers in Israeli settlements. Successfully sued Israeli companies for wage theft. Subjected to death threats from Israeli settlers. Organized 2023 general strike during Gaza assault.
resistance_actions: Exposed Israeli companies using Palestinian child labor
profiles.legal_status: Under Israeli Shin Bet surveillance for 'economic resistance'

profiles.name: Samir Toubbeh
profiles.bio: Former PGFTU leader who built global solidarity networks with European trade unions. Organized successful campaigns against Israeli arms manufacturers. Blacklisted from 15 countries under Israeli pressure. Currently coordinates international boycott of Israeli diamond industry.
resistance_actions: Negotiated Palestinian worker protections with EU unions
Organized dockworker boycotts of Israeli shipping
Lobbied for Palestinian labor rights at ILO conferences
profiles.legal_status: Banned from entering EU under Zionist lobbying

orgs.name: Palestinian General Federation of Trade Unions (PGFTU)
orgs.mission: Umbrella organization for 150,000 Palestinian workers resisting Israeli apartheid through strikes, boycotts, and international solidarity. Banned by Israeli military orders but continues underground operations.
key_campaigns: International campaign against Caterpillar (construction equipment used for home demolitions)
orgs.membership: 150,000+ workers across West Bank, Gaza, and refugee camps

orgs.name: Workers' Advice Center (WAC-MAAN)
orgs.mission: Legal advocacy and organizing for Palestinian workers exploited in Israeli settlements. Successfully won $50M+ in back wages. Documented systematic wage theft and unsafe working conditions.
key_campaigns: Legal action against Israeli companies violating labor laws
Campaign for Palestinian worker rights in East Jerusalem
International advocacy for Palestinian labor rights at ILO

orgs.name: Union of Agricultural Work Committees (UAWC)
orgs.mission: Organizes Palestinian agricultural workers against land confiscation and settler violence. Operates 50+ cooperatives providing food security. Targeted by Israeli forces for 'economic resistance'.

orgs.name: Palestinian Engineers Union
orgs.mission: Professional union organizing Palestinian engineers against Israeli technology apartheid. Exposes Israeli surveillance technology used for occupation. Coordinates international boycott of Israeli tech companies.
key_campaigns: International solidarity with Palestinian tech workers
Exposure of Israeli military-tech complex connections

actions.title: International Workers' Solidarity with Palestine
actions.description: Global campaign coordinating labor actions against Israeli apartheid. Features dockworker boycotts, corporate divestment, and solidarity strikes. Successfully pressured 200+ multinational corporations to divest from Israeli-linked companies.
key_demands: Divest from companies complicit in apartheid

actions.title: Campaign for Palestinian Workers' Rights
actions.description: Legal advocacy campaign documenting Israeli violations of Palestinian labor rights. Successfully sued Israeli companies in international courts. Exposed systematic wage theft and forced labor conditions.
key_demands: End forced labor in Israeli settlements
Prosecute Israeli companies for wage theft

actions.title: Boycott Israeli Settlement Products
actions.description: Consumer campaign exposing products made in illegal Israeli settlements. Created barcode scanner app identifying settlement goods. Successfully lobbied EU to ban settlement product imports.
key_demands: EU ban on settlement product imports

actions.title: General Strike Against Occupation
actions.description: Annual Palestinian general strike organized by PGFTU. Features work stoppages, street protests, and international solidarity actions. 2024 strike involved 300,000+ workers despite Israeli repression.

sources.title: ILO Report on Palestinian Labor Rights

additional_context.labor_statistics: 700,000+ Palestinians work in Israeli settlements under exploitative conditions. Average wage gap: 60% less than Israeli workers. 40% work without contracts. 25% face workplace violence.
additional_context.israeli_repression: 50+ Palestinian labor leaders imprisoned without trial. 200+ labor organizers subjected to administrative detention. 15+ labor unions banned by Israeli military orders.
additional_context.global_solidarity: 50+ international trade unions have endorsed Palestinian labor rights. 200+ multinational corporations divested under pressure. EU voted to ban settlement product imports (blocked by US).
